body_content.explanation: the white seed of some pine trees, used in cooking:
examples: We ordered bruschetta with mushrooms and pignoli.
The toasted pignoli nuts in this recipe add richness and texture.
Pignolia are harvested from pine trees in different parts of the world.

body_content.explanation: an Italian biscuit made with pignoli nuts and almonds (= a type of nut with an oval shape):
examples: Pignoli cookies are an Italian confection made of pine nuts, sugar, and almond paste.
If you go into an Italian bakery in New York, you’ll find a pine nut-sugar cookie called a pignoli.
Pignoli are sweet and chewy Italian pine nut cookies.
